title: What benefits will be given to students under the EWS category in the JEE? - Quora

response.answer_text: Thanks for A2A. Here i have given Branchwise Cutoff Rank of NIT Trichy for General category as well as EWS category and i think you are smart enough to analyze either EWS category students got benefits or not! Branch - cutoff (Gen) - cutoff (EWS) Chemical Eng - 11570 - 22549 Civil Eng - 12924 - 15375 Computer Science - 1536 - 2937 Electrical and Electronics - 5389 - 6227 Electronics and Communication Eng - 3571 - 6088 Instrumentation and Control Eng - 13617 - 15688 Mechanical Eng - 6843 - 12760 Metallurgical and Materials Eng - 19288 - 29773 Production Eng - 20846 - 29692 Thanks for Reading Please Upvote. It encourages me to write more. Signing off… Intrepide!!

Last year MHRD has decided to give 10% reservation to general candidates who comes under the rules of EWS ( economically weaker section) ,who studies in central educational institutions. There are certain criterias to get that facility. Althouth last year in some of the states like west bengal had not implemented that EWS scheme and nobody was able to issue that very certificate. Even I couldn't issue that certificate. So I could not report to NIT durgapur. Coming to the point there will be a very slight difference between cutoff's of general and general EWS. although there will be a 10 percent reservation for general candidates. I think it is not very much benifitial to the candidates as total no of seats under this category is not very much . But if you comes under this, please apply for it if you can issue it before time. It may help you.
